data.title: Dinner
data.text: Visited Bangkok Sala cafe last night before I went home from work hence it's right by my workplace. I order the pad Thai curry noodle. It was delicious!  Definitely recommend this place!

data.title: Surprisingly good
data.text: Great warm and friendly staff.  Really surprised by the food quality and quantity for a small strip-mall location.  Easy walk from nearby hotel.  Will stop in again next time in town.

data.title: Great diner for families
data.text: I love bangkok sala cafe! My family and i have been long time customers here... We usually order noodles and fried rice... We never leave disappointed. Great food and great service!!

data.title: Worst of the Worst
data.text: There is no good Thai restaurant in my local area. But this is the worst among them. Neither my seafood dish nor my wife's beef dish tasted good. The waitress removed leftover rice without talking to us when I went to the bathroom. I was still working on that.

data.title: Authentic Thai food with actual spice levels
data.text:
Bangkok Sala is a small place where you get really good Thai Food and they do put in actual spice level in your food unless they are in a rush and customize all the plates to a single spice level. However said that , they do take care that the food is spicy and each tastes different than the other.
Lunch time is quite a rush. Dinner time is good.

data.title: Good for a quick bite.
data.text:
The place is good for a quick bite but nothing to write home about.

Parking is available right outside, which is convenient.

data.title: Adverage
data.text: I live close by so I decided to try this place.  I ordered the chicken pad thai and my husband had sweet & sour chicken.  The prices were a little high.  Those two items were 24.00 and they were ok, nothing to write home about.  We ordered take out and I picked it up.  The staff was very friendly but as I said the food was ok.  I hope to find a better place near by that serves good thai.

data.title: Authentic average Thai.
data.text: I went to this place to check it out since I am greatly fond of Thai cuisines.  I tried thier veggie version of a Tom Yum, lots of vegetables and a bit of tang to it, but lack luster as far as overall flavor.  I ordered the Chef's Thai Fried Rice with garlic sauce, it was well below average for me and lacked any heat or sabor.  I think all Fried rice should have a hint of soy in it myself, had to add an half a Tbs to make it edible and get it down the hatch.  If I am ever in a pinch and running late I might come back for some spring rolls and soup, but if you have a bit more time, advise to keep on driving along 12 mile or head north on Orchard Lake or continue onto Farmington perhaps?

data.title: Authentic Thai curry
data.text: If you like hot and spicy this is it. I had chicken fried rice curry and it reminded me of food in Bangkok restaurants.

data.title: Best Thai restaurant on the Orchard Lake Rd corridor
data.text: We have been going to Bangkok Sala for several years and can't understand why it isn't busier. We periodically try one of the others within a few miles, but always return. Food is slightly inconsistent, but ranges from pretty good to excellent. Likewise for service -- usually basic, but friendly. (Better than many of its competitors.) Spicing levels are fairly accurate. Definitely worth a visit.

data.title: Great Thai food in a pleasant restaurant
data.text: I had sworn off Thai food completely after a terrible meal at another local place (with Siam in the name).  I finally agreed to try it again after my husband's urging, this time doing some research in advance.  Bangkok Sala Cafe was a revelation -- I can't wait to go back!  There were only two other diners on a quiet Monday night.  I ordered the Sinn Pak Delight and was very impressed: lots of tender shrimp, a nice assortment of fresh vegetables that retained their character, and a brown sauce that was light and delicious.  The Mild+ spice level had gentle warmth.  My husband had Gang Gai with Thai red curry sauce, with loads of intricate flavors.  The restaurant is only 10 minutes from our home, and I'm sorry I didn't go before.  With good food, a wide-ranging menu, pleasant service and modest pricing, I will be a regular from now on!

data.title: Comfy small diner w/ friend staff & good food
data.text: Bangkok Sala cafe is a nice quiet place for a peaceful dinner for the family. The food is great I love the pad ped curry with beef!

data.title: fresh and tasty
data.text:
Like many great restaurants, you need to go early at lunch to make sure you get a table.  Service and atmosphere are nothing special.  However, the food is superb.  I have had three different dishes here, and all three were freshly prepared (and did not seem to be "assumbled" from partially cooked ingredients), spiced as requested, and served in ample portions.  Recommend: cashew chicken and pad ga prow.
Lunch menu is in the $8-10 range for most entrees; includes soup and chips on table.
